alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 7:27AM CDT until August 04 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Missouri, including the following county, Osage. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported several roadways in the warned area covered in water due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Linn, Wardsville, Bland, Freeburg, Chamois, Westphalia, Rich Fountain, Meta, Argyle, Morrison, Loose Creek, Frankenstein, Bonnots Mill and Koeltztown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
